SENT.plain: Twenty three Zimbabwean African patients who satisfied the French-American-British(FAB) diagnostic criteria for the myelodysplastic syndromes(MDS) at Godfrey Huggins School of Medicine, University of Zimbabwe, between July 1985 and June 1987 are presented
The disorders appear not to behave differently from those reported in Caucasian populations with regard to clinical and haematological features

Refractory anaemia (RA) occurred in 12 (52.2%) patients; refractory anaemia with ringed sideroblasts (RARS) in 4 (17.4%) patients; refractory anaemia with excess blasts (RAEB) in 2 (8.7%) patients; refractory anaemia with excess blasts in transformation (RAEB-T) in 3 (13.0%) patients; while chronic myelomonocytic leukaemia (CMML) was observed in 2 (8.7%) patients
In 19 cases, the disease was primary and in 4 prior exposure to myelotoxic agents resulted in secondary MDS
The clinical significance of recognising the disorders is briefly high-lighted together with our current treatment protocol
